intro: Chaetogastra glomerata, commonly known as the clustered chaetogastra, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences and distinctive, hairy leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it of interest to botanists and horticulturists studying tropical flora.
